hunterMoves.description: Rolls 2d6 + cool and provides the corresponding outcome for Act Under Pressure. Trying to do something under conditions of particular stress or danger.

params.name: forward
params.description: Adds a negative or positive value to the roll.

params.name: hunter
params.description: Uses a different user's hunter stats for the roll instead of your own.

examples.outcome: rolls 2d6 + your cool + 2.
rolls 2d6 + Billy's cool.

hunterMoves.description: Rolls 2d6 + cool and provides the corresponding outcome for Help Out. When you help another hunter with a move they are making.

params.name: forward
params.description: Adds a negative or positive value to the roll.

params.name: hunter
params.description: Uses a different user's hunter stats for the roll instead of your own.

examples.outcome: rolls 2d6 + your cool + 2.
rolls 2d6 + Billy's cool.

hunterMoves.description: Provides info and outcomes on basic and special moves. Must provide either a basic move or special move key.

params.name: basicmove
params.description: The basic move you'd like info on.

params.name: specialmovekey
params.description: The key of the special move you'd like info on.

examples.outcome: provides info, property modifiers, and potential outcomes for the help out move.
provides info, property modifiers, and potential outcomes for the premonitions move.

hunterMoves.description: Rolls 2d6 + sharp and provides the corresponding outcome for Investigate A Mystery. Investigating for more information about what's going on.

params.name: forward
params.description: Adds a negative or positive value to the roll.

params.name: hunter
params.description: Uses a different user's hunter stats for the roll instead of your own.

examples.outcome: rolls 2d6 + your sharp + 2.
rolls 2d6 + Billy's sharp.

hunterAdmin.description: Qualifies the hunter for a move's advanced outcome. Can either be a basic move or a special move. Must provide one or the other.

params.name: basicmove
params.description: The basic move you'd like to advance.

params.name: specialmovekey
params.description: The key (typically a 2-4 letter abbreviation) of the special move you'd like to advance.

params.name: remove
params.description: Remove an advanced move. Defaults to false.

params.name: hunter
params.description: Advances or removes the move for a different user different user instead of your own.

examples.outcome: advances kick some ass for your user.
advances a special move with a key of 'prem' for your user.
removes investigate a mystery from your advanced moves.
advances kick some ass for Billy.

hunterAdmin.blurb: Manages custom properties for a hunter.
hunterAdmin.description: Creates, removes, or updates a custom property to the hunter's stats. Sometimes it's useful to be able to track something outside of luck, tough, etc.

params.name: transaction
params.description: Whether you'd like to create, remove, or update the value of a custom property.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the property.

params.name: value
params.description: The numerical value to set for your custom property. Required for update.

params.name: hunter
params.description: Creates, removes, or updates a custom property for a different hunter's stats instead of your own.

examples.outcome: creates a custom property for that user called 'corruption'.
sets the user's corruption property to 3.
removes the user's properety called 'corruption' if it exists.
creates a custom property for Billy called 'corruption'.

hunterAdmin.description: Make one of your hunters active, using their stats, inventory, etc. Only one can be active at a time.

params.name: id
params.description: Id of the hunter you'd like to activate. Id's are typically the hunter's initials and can be found by running /hunters view.

examples.outcome: activates a hunter named Casey Jones.

hunterAdmin.description: Takes you the hunter creation wizard where you'll add name, type, and stats for your new hunter. You'll need to have already decided on those things before you begin.

examples.outcome: kicks off the hunter creation process.

hunterAdmin.description: Removes one of your hunters. Not reversible!

params.name: id
params.description: Id of the hunter you'd like to remove. Id's are typically the hunter's initials and can be found by running /hunters view.

examples.outcome: deletes a hunter named Casey Jones if they exist.

hunterAdmin.description: Lists all your hunter's along with their id's. The active hunter is signified with a star.

examples.outcome: shows all hunters.

hunterAdmin.blurb: Provides info about or updates inventory.
hunterAdmin.description: Provides info about or updates inventory. To view inventory, don't include item or transaction.

params.name: transaction
params.description: Whether you'd like the item to be added or removed.

params.name: item
params.description: The item to add or remove.

params.name: hunter
params.description: Provides info about or updates the inventory of a different hunter.

examples.outcome: displays all of a user's inventory.
adds a banana to the active user's inventory.
removes a banana to the active user's inventory.
displays Billy's inventory.

sessionAdmin.blurb: Ends a session and calculates experience points.
sessionAdmin.description: Asks the channel the standard Monster of the Week session ending questions and calculates the experience points each hunter should get. Also allows 1 minute for all users to write down what happened during the session. These entries can be seen again using the /recap command.

examples.outcome: begins the end session ritual.
